text: Marianne Yvonne Heemskerk (born 28 August 1944 in Rotterdam, South Holland) is a former butterfly swimmer from the Netherlands, who won the silver medal in the 100 m butterfly at the 1960 Summer Olympics in Rome, Italy. She was also part of the 4 × 100 m medley relay team that finished fourth. She also participated in the 1964 Summer Olympics but did not reach the finals.Marianne Heemskerk. www.sports-reference.com Heemskerk broke the world record in the women's 200m butterfly on 12 June 1960 in Leipzig, East Germany. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:Olympic swimmers of the Netherlands Category:Dutch female swimmers Category:Female butterfly swimmers Category:Swimmers at the 1960 Summer Olympics Category:Swimmers at the 1964 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic silver medalists for the Netherlands Category:Sportspeople from Rotterdam Category:World record setters in swimming Category:European Aquatics Championships medalists in swimming Category:Medalists at the 1960 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic silver medalists in swimming
title: Marianne Heemskerk
